name: dns
title: Google Cloud DNS API
description: Configures and serves authoritative DNS records.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.desc: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

parameters.name: key
parameters.desc: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

parameters.name: oauth_token
parameters.desc: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

parameters.name: prettyPrint
parameters.desc: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

parameters.name: quotaUser
parameters.desc: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

parameters.name: userIp
parameters.desc: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

schemas.name: ResourceRecordSet
schemas.desc: A unit of data that will be returned by the DNS servers.

fields.name: type
fields.desc: The identifier of a supported record type, for example, A, AAAA, MX, TXT, and so on.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "dns#resourceRecordSet".

fields.name: name
fields.desc: For example, www.example.com.

fields.name: rrdatas
fields.desc: As defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1).

fields.name: ttl
fields.desc: Number of seconds that this ResourceRecordSet can be cached by resolvers.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of resource.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc:
The presence of this field indicates that there exist more results following your last page of results in pagination order. To fetch them, make another list request using this value as your pagination token.

In this way you can retrieve the complete contents of even very large collections one page at a time. However, if the contents of the collection change between the first and last paginated list request, the set of all elements returned will be an inconsistent view of the collection. There is no way to retrieve a consistent snapshot of a collection larger than the maximum page size.

fields.name: rrsets
fields.desc: The resource record set resources.

schemas.name: Change
schemas.desc: An atomic update to a collection of ResourceRecordSets.

fields.name: additions
fields.desc: Which ResourceRecordSets to add?

fields.name: deletions
fields.desc: Which ResourceRecordSets to remove? Must match existing data exactly.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server (output only).

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "dns#change".

fields.name: startTime
fields.desc: The time that this operation was started by the server (output only). This is in RFC3339 text format.

fields.name: status
fields.desc: Status of the operation (output only).

schemas.name: ChangesListResponse
schemas.desc: The response to a request to enumerate Changes to a ResourceRecordSets collection.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of resource.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc:
The presence of this field indicates that there exist more results following your last page of results in pagination order. To fetch them, make another list request using this value as your pagination token.

In this way you can retrieve the complete contents of even very large collections one page at a time. However, if the contents of the collection change between the first and last paginated list request, the set of all elements returned will be an inconsistent view of the collection. There is no way to retrieve a "snapshot" of collections larger than the maximum page size.

fields.name: changes
fields.desc: The requested changes.

schemas.name: ManagedZone
schemas.desc: A zone is a subtree of the DNS namespace under one administrative responsibility. A ManagedZone is a resource that represents a DNS zone hosted by the Cloud DNS service.

fields.name: dnsName
fields.desc: The DNS name of this managed zone, for instance "example.com.".

fields.name: id
fields.desc: Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server (output only)

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "dns#managedZone".

fields.name: name
fields.desc: User assigned name for this resource. Must be unique within the project. The name must be 1-63 characters long, must begin with a letter, end with a letter or digit, and only contain lowercase letters, digits or dashes.

fields.name: nameServerSet
fields.desc: Optionally specifies the NameServerSet for this ManagedZone. A NameServerSet is a set of DNS name servers that all host the same ManagedZones. Most users will leave this field unset.

fields.name: nameServers
fields.desc: Delegate your managed_zone to these virtual name servers; defined by the server (output only)

fields.name: creationTime
fields.desc: The time that this resource was created on the server. This is in RFC3339 text format. Output only.

fields.name: description
fields.desc: A mutable string of at most 1024 characters associated with this resource for the user's convenience. Has no effect on the managed zone's function.

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Type of resource.

fields.name: managedZones
fields.desc: The managed zone resources.

fields.name: nextPageToken
fields.desc:
The presence of this field indicates that there exist more results following your last page of results in pagination order. To fetch them, make another list request using this value as your page token.

In this way you can retrieve the complete contents of even very large collections one page at a time. However, if the contents of the collection change between the first and last paginated list request, the set of all elements returned will be an inconsistent view of the collection. There is no way to retrieve a consistent snapshot of a collection larger than the maximum page size.

schemas.name: Project
schemas.desc: A project resource. The project is a top level container for resources including Cloud DNS ManagedZones. Projects can be created only in the APIs console.

fields.name: id
fields.desc: User assigned unique identifier for the resource (output only).

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "dns#project".

fields.name: number
fields.desc: Unique numeric identifier for the resource; defined by the server (output only).

fields.name: quota
fields.desc: Quotas assigned to this project (output only).

fields.name: kind
fields.desc: Identifies what kind of resource this is. Value: the fixed string "dns#quota".

fields.name: managedZones
fields.desc: Maximum allowed number of managed zones in the project.

fields.name: resourceRecordsPerRrset
fields.desc: Maximum allowed number of ResourceRecords per ResourceRecordSet.

fields.name: rrsetAdditionsPerChange
fields.desc: Maximum allowed number of ResourceRecordSets to add per ChangesCreateRequest.

fields.name: rrsetDeletionsPerChange
fields.desc: Maximum allowed number of ResourceRecordSets to delete per ChangesCreateRequest.

fields.name: rrsetsPerManagedZone
fields.desc: Maximum allowed number of ResourceRecordSets per zone in the project.

fields.name: totalRrdataSizePerChange
fields.desc: Maximum allowed size for total rrdata in one ChangesCreateRequest in bytes.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

pathParams.name: managedZone
pathParams.desc: Identifies the managed zone addressed by this request. Can be the managed zone name or id.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Fetch the representation of an existing Change.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

pathParams.name: managedZone
pathParams.desc: Identifies the managed zone addressed by this request. Can be the managed zone name or id.

pathParams.name: changeId
pathParams.desc: The identifier of the requested change, from a previous ResourceRecordSetsChangeResponse.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Enumerate Changes to a ResourceRecordSet collection.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

pathParams.name: managedZone
pathParams.desc: Identifies the managed zone addressed by this request. Can be the managed zone name or id.

optinalQueryParams.name: sortBy
optinalQueryParams.desc: Sorting criterion. The only supported value is change sequence.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Maximum number of results to be returned. If unspecified, the server will decide how many results to return.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. A tag returned by a previous list request that was truncated. Use this parameter to continue a previous list request.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

pathParams.name: managedZone
pathParams.desc: Identifies the managed zone addressed by this request. Can be the managed zone name or id.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Fetch the representation of an existing ManagedZone.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

pathParams.name: managedZone
pathParams.desc: Identifies the managed zone addressed by this request. Can be the managed zone name or id.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Enumerate ManagedZones that have been created but not yet deleted.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

optinalQueryParams.name: dnsName
optinalQueryParams.desc: Restricts the list to return only zones with this domain name.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Maximum number of results to be returned. If unspecified, the server will decide how many results to return.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. A tag returned by a previous list request that was truncated. Use this parameter to continue a previous list request.

methods.name: get
methods.desc: Fetch the representation of an existing Project.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

methods.name: list
methods.desc: Enumerate ResourceRecordSets that have been created but not yet deleted.

pathParams.name: project
pathParams.desc: Identifies the project addressed by this request.

pathParams.name: managedZone
pathParams.desc: Identifies the managed zone addressed by this request. Can be the managed zone name or id.

optinalQueryParams.name: maxResults
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. Maximum number of results to be returned. If unspecified, the server will decide how many results to return.

optinalQueryParams.name: name
optinalQueryParams.desc: Restricts the list to return only records with this fully qualified domain name.

optinalQueryParams.name: pageToken
optinalQueryParams.desc: Optional. A tag returned by a previous list request that was truncated. Use this parameter to continue a previous list request.

optinalQueryParams.name: type
optinalQueryParams.desc: Restricts the list to return only records of this type. If present, the "name" parameter must also be present.
